title: FYP ‚Äì ProjectRGB
text:
ProjectRGB is a collaborative school project developed during my time at Temasek Polytechnic (September 2020), alongside a team of four members. The aim of this project was to design and implement an engaging mobile hybrid game that blends the mechanics of side-scrolling endless runners with traditional platformer gameplay.




Built with the Unity game engine
Designed for mobile platforms
Combines endless runner and platformer mechanics
Developed by a 4-member team as part of a school module
Educational, non-commercial use of third-party audio assets





Check out the gameplay video below:








In this project, I contributed to:

Gameplay logic and scripting in C#
UI design and user interaction flow
Level design and game balancing
Integration and testing on mobile devices






The audio used in ProjectRGB is not original. It was sourced from respective content owners and used solely for the purpose of this non-commercial educational project.





This project was a rewarding learning experience that strengthened my teamwork, game development, and software design skills. It laid a solid foundation for my continued interest in creating interactive, user-focused digital products.

title: Trip to Chongqing
text:
#My Trip to Chongqing
Chongqing, China ‚Äî a vibrant city known for its stunning night views, spicy food, and mountainous terrain. This trip was an unforgettable blend of culinary adventure and scenic exploration.

text:

1. Beef Noodle Soup
A local staple ‚Äî spicy, flavorful broth with tender beef and handmade noodles.



Beef Noodles





2. Street BBQ Skewers
Late-night grilled skewers with a perfect blend of spice and char.



Skewers





3. Hotpot Feast
The iconic Chongqing experience ‚Äî half-spicy, half-collagen broth with a table full of fresh meat and sides.



Hotpot





4. Sichuan Dishes Medley

Hongya Cave

Chongqing was intense ‚Äî in flavor, in color, and in experience. The mix of tradition and modernity, urban sprawl and natural beauty, made it one of the most unique destinations I‚Äôve ever visited.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
Throughout the process of completing this website assignment, I used ChatGPT, a Generative AI tool developed by OpenAI, to support and streamline my workflow. The assistance it provided was both time-saving and educational.



I chose to use ChatGPT because I wanted fast, structured guidance for: - Understanding Quarto syntax - Generating content for .qmd files - Formatting YAML headers and CSS styling - Summarizing and organizing ideas clearly
It allowed me to focus more on content curation and personal input rather than struggling with formatting or markdown structure.




Here are specific examples of how GenAI supported me:

üè† Helped me write my homepage with a balanced tone between personal and professional.
üéÆ Assisted in structuring my ProjectRGB (FYP) page with technical clarity.
üåÜ Generated content for my Chongqing trip using my uploaded images and descriptions.
üé® Suggested adjustments in style.css to resize images and improve layout.
üìö Guided me in updating _quarto.yml to ensure navigation worked correctly.






Efficiency: Saved a lot of time when generating or cleaning up markdown content.
Clarity: Provided well-structured examples and templates I could adapt.
Learning: Improved my understanding of Quarto, markdown, and how to apply custom styles.






AI-generated text sometimes lacked personal voice or nuance ‚Äî I had to edit for tone and accuracy.
I needed to double-check code blocks to ensure they met the lab‚Äôs requirements exactly.





I plan to continue using GenAI tools for:

Generating boilerplate code and documentation

Writing summaries or technical descriptions

Brainstorming structure for larger reports or projects

However, I will always verify and revise AI-generated content to ensure it aligns with context, requirements, and originality.


Using GenAI isn‚Äôt about replacing effort ‚Äî it‚Äôs about enhancing productivity while still maintaining ownership over the work.

title: Recipe ‚Äì Hainan Mifen (Êµ∑ÂçóÁ±≥Á≤â)
text:
Hainan Mifen is a popular noodle dish from Hainan, China, known for its fragrant broth, soft rice noodles, and variety of toppings. It‚Äôs a comfort food that‚Äôs both hearty and refreshing ‚Äî perfect for any time of day.






1 whole chicken or 500g chicken bones
1 small piece of ginger (sliced)
2 cloves garlic (crushed)
1 spring onion
Salt to taste
Optional: white pepper, MSG for umami





Blanched bean sprouts
Sliced poached chicken or pork belly
Preserved mustard greens (ÈÖ∏Ëèú)
Chopped coriander and spring onions
Fried garlic and shallots
Chili oil or minced chili





200g fresh Hainan-style rice vermicelli (Á±≥Á≤â)









Boil the chicken or bones in water for 5 mins to remove impurities.
Discard the water, rinse the meat, and refill the pot with 1.5L of fresh water.
Add ginger, garlic, and spring onion. Simmer for 1‚Äì1.5 hours.
Add salt (and optional white pepper or MSG) to taste.





Bring water to a boil in a separate pot.
Add the rice vermicelli and cook for 2‚Äì3 minutes until soft.
Drain and rinse under cold water to prevent sticking.





Place noodles into a bowl.
Add toppings: meat slices, bean sprouts, preserved greens.
Pour hot broth over the noodles.
Garnish with coriander, spring onion, and fried garlic.
Add chili oil or fresh chili for spice.










Êµ∑ÂçóÁ±≥Á≤â (Hainanese Rice Noodles)



Enjoy Hainan Mifen piping hot with a cold drink on the side!
The clear chicken broth, springy rice noodles, and savory toppings create a satisfying yet gentle flavor profile that‚Äôs great for breakfast or a light lunch. This dish is deeply rooted in Hainanese street food culture and represents simple comfort.





The broth can be made in advance and refrigerated for 2‚Äì3 days.
You can customize toppings with boiled egg, tofu skin, or pickled radish.
For a stronger taste, add soy sauce or black vinegar just before serving.



A simple bowl that reminds me of home. Êµ∑ÂçóÁ±≥Á≤â isn‚Äôt just food ‚Äî it‚Äôs warmth, comfort, and culture.
